Comments_List:
writing skills, especially for research papers.
an insight into modern greek culture.
the ability to analyze both books and films.
the evolving role of women in society
To read and understand literature from a different society
As a STEM major, I learend how to do 100ish pages of reading a week. I also learned a lot about Greek culture and read a lot of stuff I wouldve never read otherwise.

strengths:
- covered literature and films
- not excessive homework
- interesting homework (reading and watching films)
- class participation motivating and engaging

weaknesses:
- participation is 20% but the professor loves his course so much that he ends up doing most of the talking
- assignments and deadlines not always clearly communicated
The course was a bit disorganized at times.

DEFINITELY!!! It is such an enjoyable course. It's the type of class you look forward to, and the same goes for the readings - they are fun and interesting. If you can take this lass with Professor Syrimis, definitely do!
I would recommend this course to any student interesting in learning more about modern Greek culture or women/gender/sexuality studies.
Highly recommend if you are looking for a cool writing credit. Great professor and the class material is interesting
I would recommend this class. Its very engaging and interesting
It was a very quirky and interesting course to take as opposed to the typical English writing courses. Its definitely worth taking.
